Installation guide

Quick search

Karstnet documentation¶

Karstnet is a python 3 toolbox for the statistical analysis of karstic networks. It considers a network of karstic conduits as a graph (an ensemble of nodes and edges).

The package is a work in progress. The plan is to extend it to include several features including plausibility test, additional input/output interfaces, data base of network data, etc. Please contact us (see below) if you need further information.

Authors¶

Karstnet is developped by the Karstnet team: Philippe Renard and Pauline Collon.

Reference¶

The karstnet package implements the statistical metrics that were investigated and discussed in: Collon, P., D. Bernasconi, C. Vuilleumier, and P. Renard, 2017, Statistical metrics for the characterization of karst network geometry and topology. Geomorphology. 283: 122-142 doi:10.1016/j.geomorph.2017.01.034

The paper can be downloaded here.
